comments.body: @ScrapCodes, quick question. Is it possible to have a list of allowed filenames only instead?
Hi @HyukjinKwon, thanks for taking a look. That would disallow a user from supplying his library/framework specific configuration.

For example, if a user needs to pass his hadoop's core-site.xml. or some other framework he is trying to use, has a configuration file and for that matter, he has a custom application which can be configured.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +205,209 @@      val filteredConfFileNames =
        Set("spark-env.sh.template", "spark.properties", "spark-defaults.conf",
          "test.gz", "test2.jar", "non_utf8.txt")
      val confFileNames = (for (i <- 1 to 5) yield s"testConf.$i") ++
        List("spark-env.sh") ++ filteredConfFileNames

comments.body: nit. Indentation? I guess we need to change 100~105.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +97,101 @@
  private def podWithOwnerReference(keyToPaths: List[KeyToPath] = List(KEY_TO_PATH)) =
    new PodBuilder(fullExpectedPod(keyToPaths))
      .editMetadata()
        .withUid(DRIVER_POD_UID)

@@ -1,1 +83,87 @@
  private def fullExpectedPod(keyToPaths: List[KeyToPath] = List(KEY_TO_PATH)) =
    new PodBuilder(BUILT_DRIVER_POD)
      .editSpec()
        .addToContainers(FULL_EXPECTED_CONTAINER)
